intro: Amsinckia rugosa, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features hairy, rugose (wrinkled) leaves and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Amsinckia rugosa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
